Experience

Changa Safari Camp is an intimate safari lodge set on the shore of the beautiful Lake Kariba in Zimbabwe’s Matusadona National Park.
With a gorgeous lakeside setting, the camp offers awe-inspiring views, excellent wildlife viewing & a variety of exciting land & water-based safari activities.
Guests visiting Changa can expect action-packed wildlife adventures, impeccable service, luxurious accommodation & excellent cuisine.

Stay

Accommodation at Changa consists of 6 luxury tented suites & 2 two-bedroom family units.
Each tented suite features an en-suite bathroom, an “under the stars” outdoor shower & bath as well as a private veranda where early morning coffees can be enjoyed.
There are also 2 family tents which consist of 2 tents joined together by an inter-leading passageway. Both tents have en-suite bathrooms with the main tent having an outdoor “under the stars” bathroom as well.
The main lodge area comprises a swimming pool, bar, dining room & lounge.

Activities

Game drives, safari walks, birding & swimming are only some of the activities that Changa guests can enjoy. Others include boat safaris on the lake, fishing or visiting the scenic Sanyati Gorge.
Lazy afternoons can also be spent in a hammock reading a book.

subfolders.title: Bumi Hills Safari Lodge
subfolders.description: Perched on a hill overlooking the largest man-made lake in the world, Bumi Hills Safari Lodge offers breathtaking views of the Zambezi River & Lake Kariba’s azure waters. The park is home to a wide range of wildlife, including rhino, elephant, buffalo & lion.  Not only is Kariba’s shoreline rich with wildlife & birds, but the lodge’s proximity to Matusadona National Park allows for even more action-packed wildlife adventures.

subfolders.title: Musango Safari Camp
subfolders.description: For off-the-beaten-track travellers, there is no place like Musango Safari Camp.   Situated a short flight away from Victoria Falls, the camp is set on a private island deep within Zimbabwe’s wilderness, overlooking the waters of Lake Kariba.
